hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After Stress Events
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >15% drawdown within 5 days (stress event) followed by a 48-hour consolidation period with declining volume, a mean reversion bounce of 8-12% occurs within the next 7 trading days as liquidity returns to fill the gap.
hypothesis_content.rationale: October's liquidity crash created structural gaps that were subsequently filled. Market makers and institutional desks systematically re-enter after extreme stress when volatility compresses and funding turns negative, creating asymmetric risk/reward.
entry_conditions: Subsequent 48-hour consolidation with daily volume <80% of 30-day average
RSI(14) <30 and holding for 2 consecutive days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 8% gain from entry OR 12% gain if reached within 3 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% loss from entry OR new 5-day low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such setups lead to further declines >10% instead of reversal, OR average return <3% across 20+ instances.
